instruction_text:
To fix monitor detection issues:

1. Check physical connections:
   - Verify cable is securely connected (HDMI, DisplayPort, VGA, DVI)
   - Try unplugging and reconnecting cable
   - Test with different cable if available
   - Check cable for damage

2. Check input source on monitor:
   - Use monitor menu to select correct input source
   - Try different input ports on monitor
   - Verify monitor is powered on

3. Windows display detection:
   - Right-click desktop > Display settings
   - Click 'Detect' button
   - Check 'Multiple displays' settings
   - Try 'Extend' or 'Duplicate' options

4. Update graphics drivers:
   - Device Manager > Display adapters
   - Right-click graphics card > Update driver
   - Or download latest from manufacturer (NVIDIA, AMD, Intel)
   - Restart after driver update

5. Check Device Manager:
   - Open Device Manager
   - Look for monitors section
   - Check for yellow warning icons
   - Right-click monitor > Enable if disabled
   - Update monitor driver if needed

6. Use Windows key shortcuts:
   - Windows + P to open projection menu
   - Try different display modes:
     * PC screen only
     * Duplicate
     * Extend
     * Second screen only

7. Test with different port:
   - If laptop: try different video output port
   - If desktop: try different graphics card port
   - Use adapter if port types don't match

8. Restart display services:
   - Services.msc
   - Find 'Plug and Play' service
   - Restart the service
   - Restart computer

9. Reset display settings:
   - Display settings > Advanced display settings
   - Reset resolution
   - Check refresh rate settings
   - Remove and re-add monitor

10. Check graphics card:
    - Verify graphics card is working
    - Test with known-good monitor
    - Check if integrated graphics interfering
    - Disable/enable graphics adapter in Device Manager

11. BIOS/UEFI settings:
    - Enter BIOS setup
    - Check display settings
    - Enable external display if disabled
    - Check primary display adapter setting

12. Power cycle:
    - Turn off monitor and computer
    - Unplug both from power
    - Wait 30 seconds
    - Reconnect and power on

13. Test monitor on different computer:
    - Verify monitor works elsewhere
    - If monitor works, issue is with computer
    - If monitor doesn't work, monitor may be faulty
